t: For the choir director: on the Gittith. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn our Lord, how*ln magnificent is your name throughout the earth! You*ln have covered the heavens with your majesty.
From*ln the mouths of infants and nursing babies, you*ln have established a stronghold on*ln account of your adversaries in*ln order to silence the enemy and the avenger.
When*pn I observe your heavens, the*ln work of your fingers, the*ln moon and the stars, which*ln you set in place,
what*ln is a human being that you remember him, a*ln son of man that you look after him?
You*ln made him little less than God and*ln crowned him with glory and honor.
You*ln made him ruler over the works of your hands; you*ln put everything under his feet:
all*ln the sheep and oxen, as*ln well as the animals in the wild,
the*ln birds of the sky, and*ln the fish of the sea that*ln pass through the currents of the seas.
Lord,*spn our Lord, how*ln magnificent is your name throughout the earth!
